brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to explore if chlorogenic acid is safe in patients with cancer.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Trial of Chlorogenic Acid in Patients With Advanced Cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  advanced cancer with no effective treatment

          -  Karnofsky performance status no less than 70

          -  adequated organ function

          -  informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  allergic to chlorogenic acid

          -  persistent toxicities from previous treatment (no less than grade 2)

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Trial Evaluating Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Chlorogenic Acid for Injection in Patients With Advanced Cancer

other_outcome.measure: Change in number of red blood cell and level of hemoglobin
other_outcome.time_frame: within 1 year after the first dose of chlorogenic acid

other_outcome.measure: change in the diameters of lymph node metastasis
other_outcome.time_frame: within 1 year after the first dose of chlorogenic acid

other_outcome.measure: change in levels of tumor markers
other_outcome.time_frame: within 1 year after the first dose of chlorogenic acid

primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 60 days after the first dose of chlorogenic acid

secondary_outcome.measure: improvement in cancer-related symptoms and quality of life
